In the name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
I am writing, O Aḥmad b. Hudayy - may God prolong your life and may He cause your might and strength to continue -
from Qûṣ in safety and good health - praise and thanks be to their giver - on Thurs-
day when eight (nights) had passed of Raǧab - may God make it honoured for his favourite - and blessings on all
the years to come; and praise be to God, the Lord of all created beings. Now I have written many letters to you
since the day of the last incidents to the patricius, and I have already requested you to write me
from Aḫmîm, but you have not done so. And there came a letter of Bišr's to his brothers with Faraǧ al-Baṭrîqî, but he had no
letter for you. Now I have already written two notes to you through Yaḥyâ - may God exalt him - before this present one
of which you may become aware. Thereafter arrived the rest of the timber which is (now) in Luxor, viz.
twenty-six pieces, which I had already loaded on the ferry-boat of ʿÎsâ b. Tanûs, who has there delivered them (i.e. in Luxor), ... und ich habe es (sc. das Holz) auf die Fähre von ʿĪsā b. Tanūs verladen (lassen) - Gott lasse sie wohlbehalten ankommen!
and six pieces (from a former stock ?) were still in Luxor, nay, two (pieces) thereof have been discharged in the island (al-Ǧazīra), and (there are) two (pieces) lying in the sand, Und es sind in Luxor sechs Stück (Holz) verblieben, die noch nicht verladen worden sind. ...
and two pieces, which had been on the crab (ϰάραβος), were found spoiled and damaged, so that they were not loaded.
My lord the judge - whose might may God cause to continue - would like to write a letter for me to both the masters - may God strengthen
them - respecting the keeping back of twelve dînârs, and I hope that they will do (so). For you know that
... Denn wenn sie diese (12 Dinar) stehen lassen, the master - may God strengthen him - has to pay six dînârs all in all. But verily, they have kept them (sc. the six dînârs) back
erlangen wir (dadurch) hierin (sc. bei der finanziellen Transaktion) Erleichterung. Und ich einigte mich mit Abū Ǧaʿfar - Gott stütze ihn - darauf, daß, in spite of our claim according to that confirmation, and I have agreed with Abû Ǧaʿfar - whom God may strengthen - that,
supposing you find it suitable, I have kept back two dînârs from your debt, and I have booked this with the fourteen dînârs, which are wenn sie (sc. die 12 Dinar) stehen bleiben, ich in Deinem Namen zwei Dinar stehen lasse. ...
... und das Guthaben des Scheichs beträgt sechs (Dinar). Wenn diese Transaktion abgeschlossen ist, with the master and also (with) Abû Ǧaʿfar - may God exalt him - and a small balance remains in favour of the master. This is perfect.
Now Abû Ǧaʿfar has brought on his behalf and on behalf of ʿAlî two hundred and twenty dînârs, while you all shall pay thirty übernimmt Abū Ǧaʿfar für sich und für ʿAlī zweihundertzwanzig Dinar. ...
dînârs, and Yaḥyâ shall pay four dînârs instead of the sum of fifty-eight (dînârs); and you may balance the whole amount thereof ... und eine Gruppe (von restlichen Personen) übernimmt hiervon
(jeweils) zwei Dinar. ... with two dînârs. I have already written the memorandum for Yaḥyâ respecting the bond of Abû Ǧaʿfar for that which is to my credit and to your credit, this being with

And after I had written this letter, ʿUmar b. Ṣâliḥ came and removed the timbers. And after I had written this letter, ʿUmar b. Ṣâliḥ came and the timbers were removed. Nachdem ich diesen Brief geschrieben hatte, kam ʿUmar b. Ṣāliḥ und beschlagnahmte die Bretter.
Er sagte, er werde (sie) nur für zweieinhalb Dinar freigeben. ... So schrieb ich denn Deinem Vater, er möge mir den Dinar übersenden, He said "We are not satisfied but with two dînârs and a third (of a dînâr)". So I wrote to your father, that he should pay me in cash the dînâr,
den ich ihm gegeben hatte. ... which I had handed over to him that he should pay it to him; and I will pay him the rest〚and it suffices〛.
This discourse took place in the presence of Abû Ǧaʿfar - may God exalt him.
Er (sc. der Vater des Adressaten, vgl. r 2f.) möge also den anderen Dinar Yaḥyā - Gott stärke ihn - übergeben. 〚Now he han〛ded over the other dînâ<r> to Yaḥyâ, may God exalt him.
To my brother and lord Abû ʿAbdallâh Muḥammad b. Mûsâ from al-Ḥasan b. Nuʿmân, originating from al-Bulyanâ.
May God prolong his life and may he cause his might and ...... to continue.
